roleset.name: to bring about, cause

example.name: all arguments
example.text: The March 24 oil spill soiled hundreds of miles of shoreline along Alaska 's southern coast and wreaked havoc with wildlife and the fishing industry .
example.arg: with wildlife and the fishing industry

example.name: transitive
example.text: Such a situation can wreak havoc , as [*] was shown [*-1]by the emergency that [*T*-2] developed in soybean futures trading this summer on the Chicago Board of Trade .
example.arg: as [*] was shown [*-1]by the emergency that [*T*-2] developed in soybean futures trading this summer on the Chicago Board of Trade

roleset.note: WREAK-V NOTES: Frames file for 'wreak' based on survey of sentences in the WSJ corpus. (from wreak.01-v predicate notes)
